Homage to Bodhisattva Good Eyes We take refuge in the innumerable and boundless great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in the worlds of the ten directions.
We respectfully pay homage to the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all the sages.

Homage to GavÄá¹ƒpati, Homage to Revata, Homage to Pilindavatsa, Homage to Bakkula, Homage to MahÄkauá¹£á¹­hila, Homage to Nanda, Homage to Sundarananda, Homage to PÅ«rá¹‡a MaitrÄyaniputra, Homage to SubhÅ«ti, Homage to CÅ«dapanthaka We take refuge in the great arhats who are well-known to the assembly.
Having paid homage to the Three Jewels, we next repent.
Disciples!
We have already repented the retributions of the hells. We should now next repent the retributions of the three evil paths.
The Buddha said in the sutra:
Those with much desire suffer much distress because of seeking many benefits;
Those who are content consider even sleeping on the ground to be pleasant;
Those who are discontented are still not satisfied even if they dwell in heaven.

But when people in the world suddenly encounter an emergency, they can immediately give away their wealth without considering the amount, yet they do not know that this body is on the brink of the deep pit of the three evil paths, and with one breath not returned, it will certainly fall into it.

If there are knowledgeable people who teach them to create merit and cultivate future wholesome Dharma provisions, they stubbornly hold onto their stingy thoughts and refuse to do anything about it. Such people are extremely foolish and deluded.
Why is this so?
The Buddha said in the sutra:
When born, one does not bring even a single coin; when dying, one does not take even a single coin.

Suffering the body and accumulating wealth brings worry and distress. It is of no benefit to oneself but in vain benefits others. Without any wholesome deeds to rely on and no virtues to trust in, one will be sent to the end of life and fall into the evil paths.
Therefore, disciples,
today we sincerely bow our heads and with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Buddha.

We take refuge in the Buddha of Great Radiance in the East, the Buddha Abiding in Space in the South, the Buddha of Adamantine Steps in the West, the Buddha of Boundless Power in the North, the Buddha of Boundless Kings in the Southeast, the Buddha Who Destroys All Enemies in the Southwest, the Buddha of Stainless Light in the Northwest, the Buddha of Golden Color and Sound in the Northeast, the Buddha Playing Like a Lion in the Nadir, and the Buddha Moon Banner King in the Zenith. We take refuge in the Three Jewels in the ten directions and throughout the realm of space.
Disciples,
today we next repent of the karmic retribution of being an animal and lacking awareness;
we repent of the karmic retribution of bearing heavy burdens and plowing fields as an animal, repaying past debts;
Repent of the retribution of being unable to be free in the animal realm, being slaughtered and killed by others;
Repent of the retribution of having no feet, two feet, four feet, or many feet in the animal realm;
Repent of the retribution of being bitten and eaten by small insects in the fur, feathers, scales, and shells of animals.
Repent of such immeasurable and boundless retributions in the animal realm, and today with utmost sincerity take refuge and repent.
Disciples!
Today we next repent of the retribution of long hunger in the hungry ghost realm;
Repent of the retribution of never having heard the names of drink and water for a hundred thousand myriad years in the hungry ghost realm;
Repent of the retribution of eating pus, blood, excrement, and filth in the hungry ghost realm;
Repent of the retribution of having all the limbs and joints burning with fire when moving the body in the hungry ghost realm;
Repent of the retribution of having a large belly and a small throat in the hungry ghost realm.
Repenting like this of the immeasurable and boundless suffering retribution in the hungry ghost path, therefore today with utmost sincerity bowing our heads we take refuge and repent.
Disciples!
Today we next repent of the retribution for flattery and deceit in the path of all ghosts and asuras;
Repenting of the retribution for carrying sand, carrying stones, filling rivers and blocking the sea in the path of ghosts and spirits;
Repenting of the retribution for being born as a ghost, demon, or evil ghost such as a rÄká¹£asa or kumbhÄá¹‡á¸a, eating blood and flesh and receiving this ugly appearance.

Repenting like this of the immeasurable and boundless retribution for all sins in the path of ghosts and spirits, today bowing our heads to the Buddhas in the ten directions and the great earth bodhisattvas, we seek their compassion and repent so that they may all be extinguished.

May the disciples, by inheriting the merit generated from repenting of the retribution of the animal realm and so forth, wish to extinguish the defilements of ignorance lifetime after lifetime, to recognize the causes and conditions of their karma, to illuminate with wisdom, and to sever the bodies of the evil paths.

May we, by the merit of repenting the karmic retribution of hungry ghosts and so forth, vow that in life after life we will forever leave behind the suffering of stinginess, greed, and hunger and thirst, and always partake of the taste of the nectar of liberation.

May we, by the merit of repenting the karmic retribution of ghosts, spirits, and asuras and so forth, vow that in life after life we will be honest and without flattery, leave behind the causes of wrong livelihood and the results of ugly appearances, and bring blessings and benefits to humans and gods.

May the disciples from now until reaching the Way-place, definitely not receive the retribution of the four evil paths, except for the great compassion for sentient beings, taking on the vows and dwelling there without weariness.
Baota then entered another hell, called the Flying Knives Hell.

The hell was fifteen yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls and covered with an iron net above. In the four corners of the city, violent fires and winds came blowing on the iron mountains, the mountains grinding against each other to form sharp swords. The swords were double-edged, also like razor blades. In the empty space, there were also sounds like thunder. The swords came down from the sky, piercing the sinners' heads. Entering from the head, they came out from the soles of the feet. Entering from the back, they came out from the chest. Coming out from the left, they entered from the right. Smoke and fire burned together. In a single day and night, the sinner experienced ten thousand kinds of suffering. Dying a thousand times and being reborn a thousand times, dying ten thousand times and being reborn ten thousand times, if he managed to be reborn as a human, he would have evil sores all over his body.

The hell is fifteen yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls and covered with an iron net above. In the four corners of the city, fierce fires and winds blow, striking the iron mountains, which grind against each other and form sharp swords. The blades of the swords are also like razor blades. In the empty space, there are sounds like thunder. The swords strike each other like lightning, coming down from the sky to pierce the heads of the sinners. They enter from the head and exit from the soles of the feet, enter from the back and exit from the chest, exit from the left and enter from the right. Smoke and fire burn together. In one day and night, they experience ten thousand kinds of suffering. They die a thousand times and are reborn a thousand times, ten thousand times and die ten thousand times. If they are reborn as humans, they will have evil sores all over their bodies.

These Å›ramaá¹‡as receive the pure precepts of the Buddha but do not uphold them purely. Their minds lack compassion. They drink alcohol and eat meat, saying there is no retribution for wrongdoing. The sin of eating meat is unpardonable. For this reason, they receive this punishment.
